description: Sven Halek secretly meets trusted free zone technologists, handing over Halden’s personal logs and instructions for revealing the BCI failsafe, emphasizing a peaceful and public transition.

Technologists publish sections of Halden's logs, verifying his regret over BCI abuses and providing details of the embedded system shutdown protocol. News spreads quickly through neighborhood assemblies.
As technologists trigger the failsafe, BCI modules shut down citywide. Turnstiles, checkpoints, and service gates unlock, granting open access to transit, resources, and utilities for all residents.

Grassroots councils step in to manage daily operations—food, healthcare, work—through open assemblies. Public debate replaces automated assignments, with citizens coordinating their neighborhood’s needs.
With BCI dissolved, the Council loses relevance. Stenograd enters a new era as citizens hold citywide votes and negotiations to shape future governance, openly and without systemic automation.
